In light of Sri Lanka criminalising match-fixing, consider the following statements about the legislationâ€™s provisions:
  1. Inside information about games cannot be revealed even in interviews.
  2. Failure to report corrupt practices to government will also invite punishment.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The Sri Lankan government passed the Prevention of Offences Related to Sports Bill in November. This provides that any person related to sports cannot reveal inside information on the game in anything other than interviews and commitments that are bona fide. Statement 2 is correct: In line with the provisions of the new act, the SL government is to set up a Special Investigation Unit. Failure to report corrupt practices in sports to the SIU will invite punishments under this law. It should also be reported to the Anti-Corruption Unit of International Cricket Council according to the ICC code.
